abstract: A longtime Bank of America shareholder, who was part of the campaign to oust Kenneth D. Lewis, may finally get the opportunity to air his grievances directly to management.
snippet: A longtime Bank of America shareholder, who was part of the campaign to oust Kenneth D. Lewis, may finally get the opportunity to air his grievances directly to management.
lead_paragraph: A longtime Bank of America shareholder, who was part of the push to strip Kenneth D. Lewis of his title as chairman, may finally get the opportunity to air his grievances directly to the bank’s management, The New York Post reported.

headline.main: Critic May Get Hearing at BofA, Report Says
